result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:49 PM Defendant Edward J. Stainbrook in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case. Def. spoke with Atty Zich.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with Neeka Hoffmann.
No use of possession of dangerous weapons.

01:1 PM Defendant Edward J. Stainbrook in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward J. Stainbrook appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to reach out to P.D. or may go a different route. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. heard on bond. Atty Zich appears special for bail bond hearing. Court orders $1,000 cash bond with conditions. Atty Zich heard on no contact provision. Court gives ruling no contact will stand.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
